recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish with loodues  (Hilsa Fish in Mustard Sauce)
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Marinate the hilsa fish with turmeric powder and salt.
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish on both sides until golden brown. Set aside.
3. In the same pan, add mustard paste, green chili, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
4. Add water and bring it to a simmer.
5. Add the fried fish to the sauce and cook for a few more minutes.
6. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chitol Macher Muitha (Fish Dumplings in Gravy)
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Boil the chitol fish and remove the bones. Mash the fish meat.
2. In a pan, heat mustard oil and ghee. Fry onions until golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes.
4. Add the mashed fish meat and mix well.
5. Shape the mixture into small dumplings and steam them for 10-15 minutes.
6. In a separate pan, prepare a gravy with onion, ginger-garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt.
7. Add the steamed fish dumplings to the gravy and cook for a few more minutes.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice.

recipes.name: Panta Bhat (Fermented Rice)
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Take leftover cooked rice and soak it in water overnight.
2. In the morning, add yogurt, salt, and water to the soaked rice. Mix well.
3. Serve the panta bhat in a bowl.
4. Garnish with chopped onion, green chili, coriander leaves, and a squeeze of lemon.
5. Enjoy it as a refreshing and cooling dish.

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown.
2. Add ginger paste and garlic paste to the pan. Sauté for a minute.
3. Add shrimp and cook until they turn pink and are cooked through.
4. Add tomato puree, chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
5. Cover the pan and simmer for about 10 minutes until the flavors are well combined.
6. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.
